Topic.Title: IBM said that spain is ok!!!

Message.Msg: "why no split? 10:1 would be good for retail investors" That's a canard now. The days of trading in 1/8's and white shoe commissions are now of yore. You buy 10 shares of IBM for $200 and the commission could be $9.95. If you buy 100 shares of IBM for $20 the commission could be $9.95. I doubt very much if the IBM BOD would like to see the plain and simple "At least $20 per share in 2015" have to be restated when there is no reason to split the stock. As you may know, unlike the S&P 500 the DOW index is derived primarily from share price and not based from market cap like the S&P 500. Consequently, while IBM is one of 30, instead of an equal share of 3.33%, every daily change in IBM has an 11% influence on the DOW. The free publicity of IBM being cited for its point influence in a big DOW move either way goes along with IBM's image as the gold standard of IT. That's IBM's leadership of the world's leading index. Look at the volumes of AAPL, GOOG, AMZN and plenty of others -- the commissions are the same now for retail investors.

Message.Title: Today's Market Action
Message.Msg: Time and time again the markets open down big time only to recover nicely. It begs the question. Who is so stupid as to sell on the opening? The Dow was down almost 240 points prior to 10:00. Then the buy programs hit and the buying has continued for almost 4 1/2 hours. AAPL is a classic example today of who controls this market. That said, the markets will collapse when the big boys go short.

"Who is so stupid as to sell on the opening?" Hmmm, I wonder who is so stupid.... Beware the Ides of March - 2nd update 1-Mar-12 08:47 am This morning will be the high point for the rest of March. Make sure you have plenty of cash on hand to take advantage of a sharp correction. Sell the opening.
LOLing at the clueless Hamster, HAR!!!
